name: Yaqeen Institute for Islamic Research
mission: Books Yaqeen Books provides high-quality, well-researched Islamic books and ebooks focused on providing practical solutions to contemporary problems.
theoryOfChange: Yaqeen Institute for Islamic Research has a published document titled 'Faithful Activism: A Sunnah Framework'. This document is described as instructional notes formulated for a course, aiming to provide a systematic treatment and a guiding framework for Muslims to engage in healthy civic participation in various social spaces. It outlines 'part platform and part procedural approach—the what and the how—to achieve this aim,' focusing on 'Preservation of faith' and 'Participation with faith' to inspire active involvement in building a better society based on scriptural imperative.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://yaqeeninstitute.org/zakat (Source: https://yaqeeninstitute.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery

Strengthening alignment with specific donor segments through more urgent advocacy

dimension_explanations.alignment: Yaqeen shows a medium donor fit and a track record of addressing contemporary issues through an advocacy-based approach [4]. The organization is Zakat-eligible, maintaining a specific policy to ensure compliance with asnaf categories [2][9].
dimension_explanations.impact: The institute demonstrates high effectiveness in its niche, focusing on capacity building through research papers, infographics, and its 'DoubleTake' program [4][5]. With a total revenue of $8,759,241 and a program expense ratio of 86.1%, the organization efficiently converts donations into educational outputs [1][3].

The institute maintains a high level of financial transparency and accountability, as evidenced by its 96.96.0/100 from Charity Navigator score [1].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization demonstrates strong financial health and operational efficiency, though its overall score is balanced by its focus on capacity building rather than direct service delivery.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently meets only 10 out of 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards, missing benchmarks related to Board Oversight and Effectiveness Policy.
While digital reach is well-documented, the organization lacks specific cost-per-beneficiary data to fully assess program cost-effectiveness.

bbb_assessment.summary: Meets 10 out of 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains a Platinum Candid seal and a high Charity Navigator score, indicating overall strong financial health.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns relate to governance standards and the depth of impact measurement beyond digital engagement metrics.

confidence.notes: Strong financial transparency and digital metrics.

credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could address the unmet BBB standards regarding board oversight and effectiveness policies.

rich_narrative.headline: Yaqeen Research Institute Inc addresses contemporary challenges through high-quality Islamic research and educational resources.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support high-quality Islamic research, digital education, and curriculum development for the modern Muslim community.
donor_motivations: Value intellectual and educational development in the Muslim community
Want to support digital content that reaches millions globally
Prioritize organizations with exceptional financial efficiency
giving_considerations: Impact is primarily measured in digital reach and curriculum adoption rather than direct humanitarian relief
Organization operates in the advocacy and education space
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking direct humanitarian aid, emergency relief, or hyperlocal community services.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Tracks outputs like digital views and curriculum users, but lacks rigorous third-party evaluations of long-term behavioral change.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Provides high-quality, well-researched Islamic content to build capacity and address contemporary challenges.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational content is not just consumed, but actively contributes to the intellectual and spiritual development of the community.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Consistent revenue growth and expanding digital reach suggest capacity to scale educational programs further.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its massive digital reach and <cite id="[3]">86.1% program expense ratio</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization directs all of its funding to its core mission, maintaining a <cite id="[3]">86.1% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>.
Yaqeen has achieved massive scale in its educational content, with <cite id="[4]">20,500,000 digital views for its Ramadan series</cite>.
The institute has earned a <cite id="[1]">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong governance and financial health.

strengths_deep_dive: Yaqeen Research Institute Inc demonstrates a highly efficient operational model. By maintaining a <cite id="[3]">86.1% program expense ratio</cite>, the organization ensures that donor contributions are maximized for educational impact. Their digital-first approach allows them to reach a global audience, evidenced by <cite id="[5]">37,075 students using its curriculum</cite> and millions engaging with their seasonal content. Furthermore, their financial stability is robust, supported by a <cite id="[3]">3.5% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Yaqeen Research Institute Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to providing <cite id="[4]">high-quality Islamic research</cite> and educational resources focused on practical solutions to modern problems. The institute operates with exceptional financial efficiency, reporting <cite id="[3]">$8,759,241 in total revenue</cite> for 2023 with a <cite id="[3]">86.1% program expense ratio</cite>. It maintains a <cite id="[1]">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and demonstrates remarkable fundraising efficiency at <cite id="[1]">$0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization's digital impact is substantial, recording <cite id="[4]">20,500,000 digital views for its Ramadan series</cite> and reaching <cite id="[5]">37,075 students using its curriculum</cite>. The charity is <cite id="[2]">zakat-eligible</cite> and holds a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
